ack.p: This article was generated by partners of the NATO-HFM-ET-118 “Development of fast and reliable detection methods for zoonotic agents”. In Germany parts of the results were generated in the VICCI-subproject “Study on the occurrence of rodent-borne zoonoses along a climate-gradient in the Bohemian National Park” (“Studie zum Vorkommen Nagetier-übertragener Zoonosen entlang eines Klimagradienten im Nationalpark Bayerischer Wald”) financed by the Bavarian Ministry of Environment and Health. The views expressed in this article are those of the authors and do not reflect the official policy or position of the German Department of Defense, or the German government. This work was partially funded by the KHID WB33 project of the Belgian Ministry of Defense.
